title: Add Search Functionality to Prompt Library
content:
Add a real-time search feature to the Prompt Library application that allows users to search through prompts by title, content, or associated notes.

**Requirements:**

1. **Backend Changes:**
   - Modify `get_prompts()` in `app/crud.py` to accept an optional `search_query` parameter
   - Implement case-insensitive search using SQL ILIKE across:
     - Prompt title
     - Prompt content
     - Associated notes content
   - Use LEFT OUTER JOIN with Notes table and DISTINCT to avoid duplicate results
   - Maintain existing ordering by `updated_at` descending

2. **API Endpoint:**
   - Add new `/search` GET endpoint in `app/main.py`
   - Accept query parameter `q` for search term
   - Return filtered prompt list using `components/prompt_list.html` template
   - Handle empty/whitespace-only queries by returning all prompts

3. **Frontend UI:**
   - Add search bar in `templates/index.html` above the "Add New Prompt" section
   - Use HTMX for real-time search as user types:
     - `hx-get="/search"` to call search endpoint
     - `hx-trigger="keyup changed delay:300ms"` for debounced input (300ms delay)
     - `hx-target="#prompts-list"` to update prompt list
     - `hx-swap="innerHTML"` to replace list contents
   - Style with TailwindCSS: full-width input with search icon on left
   - Use SVG magnifying glass icon positioned absolutely within input

**Technical Details:**
- Use SQLAlchemy OR operator (`|`) for multiple search conditions
- Apply `f"%{search_query}%"` pattern for partial matching
- Leverage existing HTMX component architecture for seamless integration
- No page reload required - updates happen in place

**Expected Behavior:**
- Users type in search box â†’ results filter automatically after 300ms pause
- Search matches any prompt containing the term in title, content, or notes
- Case-insensitive matching
- Empty search shows all prompts
